Utterance: Hi! It’s great to see you again. How have the past week and your goals been for you?
Hey! It’s been alright. I tried to play with my dog more, and I think it helped a bit.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it feel to set aside that time for him?
It was nice. Just being outside and playing fetch made me feel a little better.
That’s fantastic! And how about the eating habits? Were you able to try eating smaller meals?
I did! I started making sandwiches or having some fruit. It’s been easier than I thought.
That’s great progress! How did that impact your mood or energy levels?
I think it helped a little. I felt less sluggish, so that’s a win.
Absolutely! Small victories can lead to bigger changes. Now, how about the sleep? Were you able to try reading or listening to music before bed?
I tried reading, but I fell asleep pretty quickly. So I guess that’s a good thing!
That’s definitely a good thing! It sounds like you’re finding some effective strategies to help you unwind.
Yeah, I’m surprised it worked so well.
It’s great to discover what works for you. Is there anything you found challenging this past week?
I still have moments where I feel really down, especially when I think about the job situation.
That’s completely understandable. Job searching can be really taxing emotionally. How do you cope with those feelings when they arise?
I try to distract myself, but sometimes it feels like it just lingers.
That’s tough. Would you be open to exploring some mindfulness techniques together that might help with those feelings?
Sure, I’d like that.
One technique is called “grounding.” It involves focusing on the present moment and can help reduce feelings of anxiety or sadness. Would you like to try a quick exercise now?
Okay, let’s do it.
Great! Let’s start by taking a deep breath in... and out. Now, I want you to focus on your feet. Feel them touching the ground. Can you describe what you feel?
Uh, it feels solid. Like I’m really here.
Exactly! Now, let’s move up to your legs. Notice any sensations there. Just observe without judgment.
They feel a little tense, but I can feel the chair supporting me.
Good! That’s a great observation. Now, let’s take another deep breath in... and out. Remember that you can return to this exercise whenever you feel overwhelmed.
I like that. It’s simple, but it helps.
I’m glad to hear that! It’s all about finding what works for you. How about we set a goal to practice this grounding technique a few times this week?
Yeah, I can do that.
Excellent! Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I think I’m good for now. Just trying to take it one step at a time.
That’s a great mindset! Remember, progress doesn’t have to be fast. It’s all about consistency. I look forward to hearing how the week goes when we meet next.
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your help.
You’re very welcome! Take care and see you next time.
Bye!
